 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלַךְ‎</span><sub>346</sub> **verb denominative** ==be, or become king, or queen, reign==; — 

**Qal**<sub>296</sub> ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Josh.13.10|Josh 13:10]] + etc.; ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִמְלֹךְ‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוֺךְ‎</span>-) [[Exod.15.18|Exod 15:18]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּמְלֹךְ‎</span> [[Gen.36.32|Gen 36:32]] +; 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּמְלֹךְ‎</span> [[Gen.37.8|Gen 37:8]] +, (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲִתִמֲלֹךְ‎</span> [[Jer.22.15|Jer 22:15]] [[BDB#Baer|Baer]]); ***Imperative*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְלָךְֿ‎</span> [[Judg.9.14|Judg 9:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלְכָה‎</span> [[Judg.9.8|Judg 9:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלְכִי‎</span> [[Judg.9.10|Judg 9:10]]; [[Judg.9.12|Judg 9:12]] ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלֹךְ‎</span> [[Gen.37.8|Gen 37:8]]; [[1Sam.24.21|1Sam 24:21]] ***construct***. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְלֹךְ‎</span> [[1Kgs.2.15|1Kgs 2:15]] +; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלְכוֺ‎</span> [[1Sam.13.1|1Sam 13:1]] +; ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֹלֵךְ‎</span> [[Jer.22.11|Jer 22:11]] + 2 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֹלֶכֶת‎</span> [[2Kgs.11.3|2Kgs 11:3]] = [[2Chr.22.12|2Chr 22:12]] — ***be*** (become) ***king, reign***, mostly of Hebrew kings, [[2Sam.2.10|2Sam 2:10]]; [[1Kgs.16.22|1Kgs 16:22]]; [[2Kgs.3.1|2Kgs 3:1]]; [[2Kgs.9.13|2Kgs 9:13]], but also generally [[Prov.8.15|Prov 8:15]]; [[Prov.30.22|Prov 30:22]] of Canaanite, Edomite, Aramaic, Assyrian, Persian kings, etc.: [[Judg.4.2|Judg 4:2]]; [[Gen.36.31|Gen 36:31]]; [[1Kgs.11.25|1Kgs 11:25]]; [[2Kgs.8.15|2Kgs 8:15]]; [[2Kgs.19.37|2Kgs 19:37]]; [[Esth.1.1|Esth 1:1]] +; followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> local (usually city) [[Josh.13.10|Josh 13:10]]; [[Josh.13.12|Josh 13:12]]; [[Judg.4.2|Judg 4:2]]; [[2Sam.5.5|2Sam 5:5]]; [[1Kgs.11.24|1Kgs 11:24]]; [[1Kgs.14.21|1Kgs 14:21]] + often; but also [[Gen.36.31|Gen 36:31]]; [[Gen.36.32|Gen 36:32]]; [[1Chr.1.43|1Chr 1:43]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּארץ‎</span>, and even <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּכֹלאֲשֶׁרתְּֿאַוֶּה נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ‎</span> [[2Sam.3.21|2Sam 3:21]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> with people or land [[1Sam.8.9|1Sam 8:9]]; [[1Sam.8.11|1Sam 8:11]]; [[1Sam.12.14|1Sam 12:14]]; [[1Sam.13.1|1Sam 13:1]]; [[1Kgs.15.1|1Kgs 15:1]]; [[1Kgs.15.9|1Kgs 15:9]]; [[1Kgs.16.23|1Kgs 16:23]] + often; followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> local + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> territory (or population) [[2Sam.5.5|2Sam 5:5]]; [[1Kgs.11.42|1Kgs 11:42]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּחַת‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חַחְתָּיו‎</span>) [[2Sam.16.8|2Sam 16:8]]; [[Gen.36.33|Gen 36:33]]f. = [[1Chr.1.44|1Chr 1:44]]f., [[1Kgs.14.20|1Kgs 14:20]]; [[1Kgs.14.31|1Kgs 14:31]]; [[2Kgs.8.15|2Kgs 8:15]]; [[2Kgs.13.24|2Kgs 13:24]]; [[Jer.22.11|Jer 22:11]] + often; subject God, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span> [[Ps.47.9|Ps 47:9]]; [[Mic.4.7|Mic 4:7]]; [[Ezek.20.33|Ezek 20:33]]; [[1Sam.8.7|1Sam 8:7]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> [[Isa.24.23|Isa 24:23]] absolute [[Exod.15.18|Exod 15:18]]; [[Isa.52.7|Isa 52:7]]; [[Ps.93.1|Ps 93:1]]; [[Ps.96.10|Ps 96:10]] = [[1Chr.16.31|1Chr 16:31]]; [[Ps.97.1|Ps 97:1]]; [[Ps.99.1|Ps 99:1]]; [[Ps.146.10|Ps 146:10]] +; subject future (Messianic) king [[Isa.32.1|Isa 32:1]]; [[Jer.23.5|Jer 23:5]] subject a woman (= ***be queen***) [[2Kgs.11.3|2Kgs 11:3]] = [[2Chr.22.12|2Chr 22:12]] (both followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span>), [[Esth.2.4|Esth 2:4]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּחַת‎</span> ; Imperative only in fable, king of trees, [[Judg.9.8|Judg 9:8]]; [[Judg.9.10|Judg 9:10]]; [[Judg.9.12|Judg 9:12]]; [[Judg.9.14|Judg 9:14]] all followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּמָלְכוֺ‎</span> especially = ***when he began to reign, became king*** [[1Sam.13.1|1Sam 13:1]]; [[2Sam.2.10|2Sam 2:10]]; [[1Kgs.14.21|1Kgs 14:21]] + often; Infinitive also = ***reign:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּשְׁנַת שְׁמֹנֶה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְמָלְכוֺ‎</span> [[2Kgs.24.12|2Kgs 24:12]]; [[2Kgs.25.1|2Kgs 25:1]], compare v[[2Kgs.25.27|2Kgs 25:27]]; [[1Kgs.6.1|1Kgs 6:1]]; [[2Chr.16.13|2Chr 16:13]]; [[2Chr.17.7|2Chr 17:7]]; [[2Chr.29.3|2Chr 29:3]]; [[2Chr.34.3|2Chr 34:3]]; [[2Chr.34.8|2Chr 34:8]], compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מְלֹךְ דָּוִד‎</span> [[1Chr.4.31|1Chr 4:31]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד מְלֹךְ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְכוּת פָּרָס‎</span> [[2Chr.36.20|2Chr 36:20]] ***began to reign and reigned*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלַךְ וַיִּמְלֹךְ‎</span> [[1Kgs.15.25|1Kgs 15:25]]; [[1Kgs.16.29|1Kgs 16:29]]; [[2Kgs.3.1|2Kgs 3:1]] +; often <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלַךְ‎</span> alone with ***same meaning*** [[1Kgs.16.23|1Kgs 16:23]]; [[2Kgs.13.1|2Kgs 13:1]]; [[2Kgs.13.10|2Kgs 13:10]]; [[2Kgs.14.23|2Kgs 14:23]] +. **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִמְלִיךְ‎</span> [[1Sam.15.35|1Sam 15:35]] + 2 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִמְלַ֫כְתָּ‎</span> [[1Kgs.3.7|1Kgs 3:7]], etc.; Imperfect <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּמְלֵךְ‎</span> [[2Kgs.33.34|2Kgs 33:34]] + 4 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּמְלִיכוּ‎</span> [[Judg.9.6|Judg 9:6]] + etc.; ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמְלִיךְ‎</span> [[1Kgs.12.1|1Kgs 12:1]] + etc.; ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַמְלִךְֻ‎</span> [[Ezek.17.16|Ezek 17:16]] — ***make king***, or ***queen, cause to reign***, followed by accusative of person [[Judg.9.16|Judg 9:16]]; [[1Sam.11.15|1Sam 11:15]]; [[1Kgs.1.43|1Kgs 1:43]]; [[1Kgs.12.1|1Kgs 12:1]]; [[1Kgs.16.21|1Kgs 16:21]]; [[2Kgs.10.5|2Kgs 10:5]]; [[2Kgs.11.12|2Kgs 11:12]] (anointing and coronation) = [[2Chr.23.11|2Chr 23:11]]; [[2Kgs.17.21|2Kgs 17:21]]; [[1Chr.11.10|1Chr 11:10]]; [[1Chr.12.32|1Chr 12:32]]; [[1Chr.12.39|1Chr 12:39]]; [[2Chr.10.1|2Chr 10:1]]; [[2Chr.11.22|2Chr 11:22]]; [[Ezek.17.16|Ezek 17:16]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִשׁלמֹה‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> of direct object, as Aramaic) [[1Chr.29.22|1Chr 29:22]] followed by accusative of congnate meaning with verb [[1Sam.8.22|1Sam 8:22]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָהֶם‎</span>), [[1Sam.12.1|1Sam 12:1]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span>), [[Isa.7.6|Isa 7:6]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּתוֺךְ‎</span>); followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְמֶלֶךְ‎</span> [[Judg.9.6|Judg 9:6]]; [[1Sam.15.11|1Sam 15:11]] followed by accusative of person + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> local [[Jer.37.1|Jer 37:1]] + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> [[Judg.9.18|Judg 9:18]]; [[1Sam.15.35|1Sam 15:35]]; [[1Kgs.12.20|1Kgs 12:20]]; [[1Kgs.16.16|1Kgs 16:16]]; [[2Kgs.8.20|2Kgs 8:20]]; [[1Chr.12.38|1Chr 12:38]]; [[1Chr.28.4|1Chr 28:4]] (accusative omitted), [[1Chr.23.1|1Chr 23:1]]; [[2Chr.1.9|2Chr 1:9]]; [[2Chr.1.11|2Chr 1:11]]; [[2Chr.21.8|2Chr 21:8]]; [[2Chr.36.4|2Chr 36:4]]; [[2Chr.36.10|2Chr 36:10]], compare [[2Sam.2.9|2Sam 2:9]] (3 t. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲלֿ‎</span>, 3 t. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span>); + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּחַת‎</span> [[1Kgs.3.7|1Kgs 3:7]]; [[2Kgs.14.21|2Kgs 14:21]]; [[2Kgs.21.24|2Kgs 21:24]]; [[2Kgs.23.30|2Kgs 23:30]] (anointing), v[[2Kgs.23.34|2Kgs 23:34]]; [[2Kgs.24.17|2Kgs 24:17]]; [[2Chr.1.8|2Chr 1:8]]; [[2Chr.22.1|2Chr 22:1]]; [[2Chr.26.1|2Chr 26:1]]; [[2Chr.33.25|2Chr 33:25]]; [[2Chr.36.1|2Chr 36:1]]; [[Esth.2.17|Esth 2:17]] (= ***make queen*** at coronation); absolute [[Hos.8.4|Hos 8:4]]. **Hoph\`al** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָמְלַךְ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל מַלְכוּת כַּשְׂדִּים‎</span> [[Dan.9.1|Dan 9:1]]. 



 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלַךְ‎</span>] **verb** ==counsel, advise== (loan-word from Aram . <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְלַח‎</span>; compare Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***malâku***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 412</sup>); — only **Niph\`al** (so Late Hebrew) ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִבִּי עָלַי וַיִּמָּלֵךָ‎</span> i. e. I considered carefully, [[Neh.5.7|Neh 5:7]]. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְכֹּ֫דֶת‎</span>] see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לכד‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְכֵּן‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְבֵּן‎</span> below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לבן‎</span>. 

 I. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מלך‎</span> (√ of following, see Biblical Hebrew). 

 II. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מלך‎</span> (√ of following; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***malâku***</u></abbr>, ***counsel, advise***; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מְלֵח‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Christian-Palestinian Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Schulth|Schulth]]<sup>112</sup>; Biblical Hebrew II. [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָלַח‎</span>] [[Neh.5.7|Neh 5:7]] as loan-word).
